name: Chaos F&E
description:
Ground Idea is gettin the three subtypes of every single piece of ice as soon as possible with test run and/or self modifying Code.
Then Attack R&D as often as Possible to Gain Agendas or Destroying Cards.
In addition there is 1 Crescentus for derezzing, Deus Ex for preventing some Net Damage and Carapace for Meat Damage.

Comments are Welcome !
Have Fun

name: Tag'n Advance
description: A NBN deck around tags ans advance. Really like it, i will test it soon.

name: Jinteki Rarely Advance
description:
This is inspired by theorycrafting discussions I've seen in /r/netrunner and elsewhere about Jinteki builds using mostly 1pt. agendas to ping the runner for net damage more often on R&D access.
It's essentially a never-advance build except for Fetal AI. I think the biggest risk to this deck is that you get points pretty slowly and if the game goes on too long you'll have a hard time keeping remotes safe for the turn you need to score. Hopefully if it gets to that point you can get an Edge of World to go off.

I'm trying out Shipment from SanSan because I advance agendas a lot, but my other choice would be Restructure, which I think I can afford between Celebrity Gift and Profiteering.

So far I've done fairly well with it but I'm certainly open to more suggestions.

name: NEXT Ice Ice Baby
description: The deck is setup to reduce the amount of agendas in R&D while stocking up on lots of ice to utilize the identity ability and an occasional Accelerated Beta Test.

name: Kate Prepaid Hostage
description:
The plan is to use Prepaid VoicePAD and either or both of Kati Jones and Professional Contacts (that both can be searched for with Hostage) as economy, and using powerful and efficient breakers to run R&D.
Hostage also has some utility in that it can search for in Decoy and The Helpful AI.

name: No Money No Problem
description:
The premise of this deck was to not use cards that generate credits, the original version had none of these assets and so was pure, but later I chickened out and I added the Melange just in case.

The idea is to abuse your very cheap ice and recurring trace credits to score something fast (not wasting your clicks on money) and then wait for a good Psychographics win, or attempt to start by scoring Restructured Datapool and use it (with your corp ability) to be very annoying and slow down the runner.

High amount of upgrades work very good with cheap ice to bluff your opponent and the lack of economy cards make your draws very consistent (no more hands with 2 agendas and 3 money making operations).

Do note that the deck is still a work in progress but I managed to score plenty wins with it. Do not attempt to play it if you cringe at the thought of paying 3 clicks to get 3 credits.
